ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How anxious, nervous or fearful do you usually get when you are in a social situation, like attending a party or meeting new people?
Notes: 1= Extremely; 2= A Lot; 3= Somewhat; 4= A Little; 5= Not At All

ElementDescription: How anxious, nervous or fearful do you usually get when you are the center of attention, like speaking up in class or at a meeting, giving a presentation in class, or talking to people in authority?
Notes: 1= Extremely; 2= A Lot; 3= Somewhat; 4= A Little; 5= Not At All

ElementDescription: How often do you get very anxious, nervous or fearful when you are the center of attention?/ALL OTHERS: How often do you get very anxious, nervous or fearful when you are in social situations or in situations where you are the center of attention?
Notes: 1= All or almost all of the time; 2= Most of the time; 3= Some of the time; 4= A little of the time; 5= None of the time

ElementDescription: How often do you try to avoid situations where you are the center of attention?/ALL OTHERS: How often do you try to avoid social situations or situations where you are the center of attention?
Notes: 1= All or almost all of the time; 2= Most of the time; 3= Some of the time; 4= A little of the time; 5= None of the time

ElementDescription: How much does your anxiety or fear of these situations interfere with your activities at home, work, school, or in your social life?/ALL OTHERS: How much does your anxiety, fear, or avoidance of these situations interfere with your activities at home, work, school, or in your social life?
Notes: 1= Extremely; 2= A Lot; 3= Somewhat; 4= A Little; 5= Not At All
